question: Good morning, Azul. Do you know who this is?
answer: Moco... What the hell do you want after all these years?

question: We've got a lot to talk about. I'm just a few town away with a whole new gang. I heard you were nearby so I thought I'd give you a call, amigo.
answer: That's sweet of you, asshole. I don't suppose you could get me out of there, and then maybe hand me over my share of money.

question: Yes, I figured you'd want your money, my friend. That is why I have called you. I heard you were getting out soon, and figured I should deal with our situation. But do you really need me to help you get out? From what I hear, you're running quite a business out of your cell with a phone and some loyal men. It keeps you well protected I hear. Not a bad idea. I may try that myself sometime.
answer: I could stay in here and earn peanuts compared to what you owe me if I were to get out. So, yes, I want you to help me... my friend.

question: Soon my friend, soon. I'm sending you some people in a few days to get you.
answer: Really? Well, that's more like it. Just like the Moco I used to know.

question: Just hang in there my friend. I won't forget that you have been a big part of our success. What's wrong.
answer: There's something going on outside. Is this a double surprise? Are you getting me out today, Moco? There are two men here with guns. Did you send them? I'm still here, Moco. And so are your little friends. But not for long. They have something they want to scream to you. Listen close, because you're going to repeat it to me when I come to visit you.

question: What do you want to drink?
answer: Refresco. No hay musica?

question: Why?
answer: I'm a mariachi. A good one. I play beautiful ballads, old classic ballads, on an old-fashioned guitar.

question: So what?
answer: I could add a little class to this place. I work for fairly cheap, I live mostly off tips. But I need steady work, and I can guarantee bringing in more customers.

question: Tell me, why would I need one little guitar player when I've already got a full band? There you see? Either I can pay one guy to sound like a full mariachi band... ... or I could spend the same money only get one little guitar player... Understand?
answer: Thank you, sir.

question: You want to earn a living? Get a real musical instrument. What the hell is this, mariachi day? There is no work for you here!
answer: Bartender... one beer. In a bottle, wey.

question: Ready.
answer: I'm looking for an old friend of mine. His name is... Moco. Do you know where I can find him. So you know him? That's too bad. Hold it please.

question: Da me telefono.
answer: Take it.

question: Pit bull?
answer: Yeah, pit bull.

question: Dead?
answer: An inside shot looking out of the front glass reveals Mariachi looking at his wallet as Mean Dude talks to the phone. No one notices him.

question: ... carries a guitar case... And what was he wearing?... all black... Don't worry, Moco. We'll find him, and we'll mess him up real good.
answer: Mean Dude hangsup the phone. He writes a few more things. He turns to leave.

question: And if I don't call, you'll kill me...
answer: Pit bull.

question: Yeah, pit bull.
answer: I need a cheap room for a week, and I'd prefer to pay you in a few days, after I've found some work.

question: S, later...
answer: Thank you... Thank you, friend.

question: Uh, excuse me seor? I forgot, I need a small deposit...
answer: You can trust me.

question: I am very sorry, seor. But... how much can you spare?
answer: I've only got a few pesos... I plan on finding work in town.

question: Mariachi is sitting on his bed listening to all this. He bolts to the restroom and turns to the shower.
answer: Shot of men still stalking, cocking pistols.

question: Mariachi rushes out of the bathroom towards the door.
answer: Men kick open the door and burst into the room.

question: Low-angle shot as men burst in. There is no one in the room. Mean Dude #5 hears the shower and motions to keep it down and stalk quietly... They rush into the bathroom and start blasting.
answer: Mariachi runs out of the room and jumps off the stairwell onto the courtyard in front of the Clerk.

question: What happened to you, Mariachi? Too much refresco?
answer: I just killed four guys.

question: Is it true?
answer: Wait a minute... what's your name?

question: Domino.
answer: Wait a minute, Domino! It was self- defense. I'm new in town. I don't know everyone!!! I have no friends here... and no enemies.

question: Thieves?
answer: No way. They were well-dressed men. I checked into the cheapest hotel in town, no money, nothing of value, except this guitar and maybe this coat, which they could have taken when I left my room, but they didn't. They were only interested in killing me.

question: So why do you come here? You want to get me killed?
answer: I need a place to stay until I figure this out. They've got me mixed up with someone else.

question: And you've never seen them before? Not even in another town?
answer: Are you saying they followed me, a mariachi, here? What for?

question: Maybe they hate your music. Maybe you were singing in another town, they hated your voice, and now they're trying to kill you.
answer: Are you serious?

question: Yes.
answer: Are you going to help me, or am I gonna have to die on your porch?

question: I have a room upstairs. My room. Don't touch anything. I'll be up after awhile and we can call a friend of mine.
answer: Thank you. I'll never forget this.

question: Good morning, Domino.
answer: What happened?

question: Give me the phone. I have to call Moco.
answer: This is a border town. I get strangers all the time.

question: Dressed all in black, carrying a guitar case?
answer: No.

question: Well, he shot me... and has killed ten of Moco's men... all in one day.
answer: Aren't you gonna call your boss?

question: Que paso
answer: I screwed up. The guy left his guitar case in the hotel room. We chased him out, but he came back for the case.

question: Maybe he loves his guitar. It's probably an antique.
answer: It wasn't a guitar. It was a guitar case full of weapons that he uses on his victims. Adios, I'm gonna take a nap. And thanks for the drink.

question: I thought I told you not to touch anything.
answer: Sorry. I needed to relax. I can...

question: No, it's alright, Finish up. Do you want shampoo?
answer: Yes, please.

question: Who are you?!
answer: I'm a musician!

question: What do you have in here? GUNS? KNIVES?
answer: No! My guitar!

question: We'll see... You're very modest, Mariachi... You told me you killed four men, when you really killed seven. Or were they still breathing even after you shot out their hearts?
answer: I'm a mariachi... ... not a murderer...

question: Aren't you going to watch?
answer: I told you... I am a musician.

question: Play it.
answer: W...w...what?

question: Play it, damnit, play something sweet!!!
answer: What is this place? That treats me like a murderer? They've all got their heads up their butts... Even this beautiful girl, With a knife to my balls, Should I kiss her or hit her... Or both?

question: You're a mariachi, all right. And a good one.
answer: I think this is the best I've ever played. You... inspired me. Hire me. I'm good. Hire me to play in your bar. I'll work mostly from tips. But, I need steady work.

question: I couldn't pay you. I have no money.
answer: This fancy place and you have no money?

question: It's the truth.
answer: I'll work for room and board, then. Please, I'm desperate.

question: Will I have to keep a knife at your balls to get you to play like that?
answer: Not if you're paying me room and board. Please... until I find a permanent job.

question: Amigo! I'm glad I've reached you! You've not answered all day. Killing ten of my men must have been very time consuming!
answer: Six.

question: What?
answer: I've only killed six! You were always bad at math, Moco. I guess that's why you never paid me half of the money. You thought it all belonged to you.

question: I knew half was yours... I got greedy, my friend. It's my nature. But you!!! You are modest! You've killed ten of my men!! I know, because I'm having them buried in my yard right now. With my dogs and cats.
answer: I killed six. But don't bother counting so soon. The number will triple by tomorrow.

question: I'm sorry things turned out this way. My friend. I got greedy. I should never have tried to kill you. It would have been cheaper for me to pay you. Now I've got to find ten new men.
answer: Six.

question: Ten.
answer: I tell you what. You give me my money, and I won't kill any more of your men... And I won't kill you.

question: No, it's too late for that. We're going to have to see this through.
answer: Just like the Moco I used to know. Still wearing white?

question: What do you think?
answer: I think you should change clothes. I'd hate to ruin a white suit with your stupid blood.

question: Can I get something to drink or eat?
answer: One beer. In a bottle, wey.

question: Sorry.
answer: Isn't there a girl that works here?

question: Yeah, she owns the place.
answer: She owns it, now? Then she is Moco's girl?

question: So-so. She's onto this new musician.
answer: Thank you.

question: I'm not sure... What's in the case?
answer: My guitar.

question: Yeah? You're one of those old-time mariachis, huh?
answer: Yes.

question: Azul opens the lid, revealing Mariachi's guitar.
answer: That's him...

question: The bad guys are pulling out their weapons.
answer: That's him...

question: I'm sorry we left... ... We figured you could defend yourself!!!
answer: You thought I could defend myself... ... against three armed men... ... using this? My case got switched with some maricon mariachi!

question: Where is this mariachi?
answer: He's dead by now... So, I want you to go look for my case. Leave me a weapon. That was disloyal of you to leave me out there. You should be as loyal to me as you are to each other. Are you loyal? Are you loyal? Then shoot him. You are loyal, are you not? SHOOT HIM. Or I shoot you.

question: I can't.
answer: Why not?

question: You said we should be as loyal to you as we are to each other. I couldn't shoot him, for that would be as disloyal as shooting you.
answer: Very good. Now go find my case.

question: Where were you when he came into the bar?
answer: I was on the phone, talking to a friend that knows what's going on.

question: Did you mention me?
answer: No... He told me the man in black is Azul.

question: If his name is Azul, why doesn't he wear blue?
answer: I don't know... Anyway, he's killing the men of the town drug dealer. The dealer's name is Mauricio. But he's known as Moco.

question: And Moco is sending these men to find Azul. So, why do they chase me?
answer: They have never seen Azul... only Moco knows him. My friend says the description Moco gave his men was that he wears black, and carries a guitar case. Sounds like you, no?

question: Couldn't you tell your friend that there are two people like that in his town? One is a killer, and one is a mariachi.
answer: Only special people can talk to Moco. Besides, you've killed a few of his men, now. Your best option is to keep out of sight, stop wearing black, and to hide that stupid case until this is all over.

question: Hello?
answer: Come see me.

question: I can't.
answer: Please.

question: I don't feel well. I've got to go.
answer: Have you ridden the bike?

question: No... I've got to go...
answer: Boyfriend.

question: No...
answer: I can't figure out something. You tell me you're poor. Poor family. Yet you've got this place.

question: This place is a gift.
answer: From who?

question: From Mauricio.
answer: From Mauricio? The man trying to kill me?

question: He's not trying to kill you, his man had you confused with Azul.
answer: Same thing.

question: Look, you now how if you want to impress a girl, you send her flowers, candy, jewelry until you win her love?
answer: Yes.

question: If one present doesn't work, you keep sending bigger and better things until you win her or you're broke?
answer: Correct...

question: Well, Mauricio sent me flowers, then jewelry, then he gave me a job at his saloon, then he gave me the whole saloon... etc.
answer: He's still giving you things?

question: He'll never run out of money.
answer: And you accept it all? What's the last thing he sent you?

question: A motorcycle. He wants me to ride out to his ranch when I've decided to be his. He thinks he's close to having me.
answer: Is he?

question: He was. Not anymore.
answer: So, you really are from a poor family.

question: I remember when I was growing up, we were so poor, that my brothers and sisters and I all slept on the same blanket stretched out across the floor. We had to sleep in a circle, with our fingers in each other's ears, to keep the bugs from crawling into them.
answer: Ay, wey...

question: What can I get you?
answer: One beer.

question: Anything else?
answer: My guitar case.

question: Where's Mariachi?
answer: Where's my case?

question: Upstairs.
answer: Get it. If you want your mariachi back, come with me.

question: Why will you help me?
answer: Because you know where Moco's ranch is... I don't. You help me, I'll help you.

question: Let's go. Mauricio!!
answer: Play along... Open the gate or she's dead!
